page.title: 09WALSDEN The Schools.
page.content: There are two schools in the district of Walsden. One is Walsden Church of England Infants school, which is an aided school, the other is Walsden Junior School which is a local authority school. At the time of writing there are 48 pupils in the Infant school and 69 pupils in the Junior school. There are 3 teachers in the Infant school, Mrs. Irene Bateman who is the head, Miss Rona Hilton and Mrs.Alison Parkinson. The chairman of the governing body is Councillor John Winstanley. There are 4 Teachers in the Junior school, Mr.John Doyle who is the head, Mr.Jack Davies, Mrs.Mary Wilson and Mrs.Freda Proctor. The chairman of the governing body is Mr.Clifford Greenwood.
